body_html:
Not sure what you mean by "dynamic path", but if I create a symbolic link in .../layers/_cudnn_rnn_ops.so to .../ops/_cudnn_rnn_ops.so it solves the problem. I believe this is a bug. I think the path in tensorflow/tensorflow/contrib/cudnn_rnn/python/layers/cudnn_rnn.py pointing to _cudnn_rnn_ops.so is incorrect.

Here's the rest of the information you requested
OS: Ubuntu 14.04
TensorFlow 1.4.0-rc0 installed from source
Python version: 2.6
Bazel version (if compiling from source): 0.7.0
CUDA/cuDNN version: 8/7
GPU model and memory: Titan X Pascal

body:
Not sure what you mean by "dynamic path", but if I create a symbolic link in `.../layers/_cudnn_rnn_ops.so` to `.../ops/_cudnn_rnn_ops.so` it solves the problem. I believe this is a bug. I think the path in `tensorflow/tensorflow/contrib/cudnn_rnn/python/layers/cudnn_rnn.py` pointing to `_cudnn_rnn_ops.so` is incorrect.

Here's the rest of the information you requested
OS: Ubuntu 14.04
TensorFlow 1.4.0-rc0 installed from source
Python version: 2.6
Bazel version (if compiling from source): 0.7.0
CUDA/cuDNN version: 8/7
GPU model and memory: Titan X Pascal
